entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who has stopped saying You-Know-Who's name. He is also referred to as 'you' by Ron, indicating that he is part of the conversation.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as being present in the tent and scowling at Ron and Harry. She is also referred to as 'you' by Ron, indicating that she is part of the conversation.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as being present in the conversation and scolding Harry for saying You-Know-Who's name. He is also referred to as 'you' by himself, indicating that he is part of the conversation.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who dared use You-Know-Who's name and was serious about standing up to him. He is referred to in a past tense, indicating that he is no longer present.

entities.name: you-know-who
entities.description: You-Know-Who is mentioned as the name that Harry and others have stopped saying. It is referred to in a way that implies it is Voldemort's real name.

entities.name: totenham court road
entities.description: Totenham Court Road is mentioned as the location where Harry, Ron, and Hermione were found by You-Know-Who's followers. It is referred to in a way that implies it is a specific address or location.

relationships.description: Ron scolds Harry for saying You-Know-Who's name. This is evident from the text where Ron says 'NO!' and causes Harry to jump into the hedge.
Ron scolds Hermione for not stopping Harry from saying You-Know-Who's name. This is evident from the text where Ron says 'Sorry' to Hermione after scolding Harry.
Harry is mentioned as saying You-Know-Who's name, which is a taboo. This is evident from the text where Ron says 'NO!' and Harry jumps into the hedge.
Hermione is mentioned as being present when Harry says You-Know-Who's name, which is a taboo. This is evident from the text where Ron scolds Hermione for not stopping Harry.
Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who dared use You-Know-Who's name. This is evident from the text where Ron says that only people like Dumbledore would dare use it.

Totenham Court Road is mentioned as the location where Harry, Ron, and Hermione were found by You-Know-Who's followers. This is evident from the text where Ron says that using You-Know-Who's name causes a magical disturbance.
